inn1.comm: and thats smashed up and over point by Sehwag, freeing his arms and thumping a wide, swinging ball from Anderson, the crowd goes berserk
short of a length this time and Sehwag pushes it to point
fuller in length with a bit of swing, Sehwag mistimes that shot with zero footwork, driving with too much bottom hand back down the track and it goes nowhere
a bouncer this time, outside off stump, which gets Sehwag up onto his toes and he plays it down in front of point, Anderson runs in and they don't chance a single
fine length on this occasion, moving away from Sehwag, who gets tall and thinks about having a flirt but wisely resists as the ball gains and carries to Prior
superb area to pitch the ball in, really a perfect length from Anderson, hits the seam and beats Sehwag as he pushes at it with no footwork, good end to the over
and he's away first ball, shuffling and nudging this one off the stumps and wide of midwicket, rolling the wrists, gets two even as Sehwag drops his bat on the second
hits a good length and straightens, Tendulkar shoulders arms
onto the front foot, coolly pushing the ball to the man at cover
pitches on a good length and Tendulkar leaves it be
movement again and Tendulkar calmly shoulders arms

too straight and thats whipped with the utmost precision and placement, Tendulkar just shuffling and working the wrists to pick the gap between square leg and midwicket to collect his first boundary, a fine shot that
a tad full and Sehwag mistimes the drive back to Anderson
unorthodox shot, but effective! Anderson pitches short, Sehwag turns and swats it straight back down the ground, well wide of mid-on and the ball rolls away
four more, as Anderson invites him with a short and wide delivery, which Sehwag obliges by reaching out and depositing it between cover and point
better length, Sehwag gets back and defends to backward point
138ks, hits a length and shapes away, Sehwag leaves
a touch fuller, straightening outside off, Sehwag shoulders arms
hits a length outside off, Tendulkar comes in and leaves it be
a touch short and he gets up, crunching it straight to point
good shot for nothing, Tendulkar gets back on his toes and drives excellently but cannot pierce the field on the off side
ah ha, a short one now at good pace, rising outside off the stump and Tendulkar flays the bat it, very narrowly missing out on getting an edge to Prior

pitches on about leg stump and hits Tendulkar rather high on the flap as he hops back and tries to defend, Broad again lets out an elongated appeal (which Andy Zaltzman would have liked!) but umpire Saheba isn't convinced ... it was going on over the stumps
gets forward and drops it towards the off side but doesn't run
good length and swing from Anderson, pitching on a length and Sehwag defends it watchfully to the off side
swinging into Sehwag's pads and he clips it just wide of midwicket
much better length and Sehwag drives it to the man at point
beaten by a terrific delivery from Anderson, who pitches short of a length in that channel outside off stump, tempting a leaden-footed Sehwag to push at t
good stuff again from Anderson, keeping Sehwag quiet with his length, he again doesn't move his feet and just gets the bat down in time, Collingwood at point fields
nips back in to Sehwag, who goes back and defends
lands on a good length and Tendulkar pushes it down past Sehwag, he wants a run but mid-on is sharp to get across and cut off any thoughts of a single

change of pace from Broad, pitching short of a length, Tendulkar gets tall and drives from his crease, getting an inside edge as he goes hard at it, it deviates down the leg side and drops well short of a tumbling Prior, then escapes down to fine leg and umpire Saheba blunders by signalling leg byes!

ah, another edge and no one moved! Poor Broad, who again drops short and gets Sehwag up on the toes, playing a cramped uppercut, there's a thick edge but Prior didn't move to his right and he and Shah at first slip look on as the ball runs away
back of a length outside off stump and he leaves this one be
thats four more! Sehwag gets loads of room and chops into the ground in front of backward point, where Collingwood dives to his right and parries the ball away
slower ball, middle and leg, easily turned wide of square leg
slides into Sehwag off a length, who plays it to midwicket
slides into him off a length and Sehwag defends to Shah
tidy stuff, short of a length on the stumps and he defends
a touch too straight and now he breaks the shackles with a single, turned away to the right of Patel on the leg side, who collects and throws it back to Prior
short of a length and he opens the face, guiding it towards gully, Collingwood tumbles around at backward point and saves certain runs, good effort there
down the pads and he turns it around the corner for a single
beaten on the big shot! Tendulkar heaves at one but the length was no on for that shot, ends up looking rather ugly after the ball narrowly beats bat
fuller now and he rolls the wrists, driving it back down the track, Broad dives to his right and takes pace off the ball, well stopped in his follow through
another shot across the line, this one was fractionally short outside off stump nut Tendulkar inside-edges back onto his thigh, the ball rolls to the gully
now thats a shot! Just short of a length outside off stump and he absolutely murders that off the back foot, smacking it between cover and point for four

would you believe it, Broad's cleaned up Tendulkar first ball after the delay! What scenes! Broad pitches on a really good length, fuller than what he's bowled to far, and gets Tendulkar driving on the up, the ball sneaks back in and disturbs the furniture as Tendulkar shapes to play through the line but the ball cut back in past the gap
some swing there, but Gambhir counters with a lovely flick for four
good swing there, pitching outside off, Sehwag shoulders arms
short, wide, and Sehwag slashes up and over gully for one
and thats poor, full and down the pads, there's movement but off the mark, Gambhir gets faint tickle on it and the ball swings wide of a diving Prior
swing again, but its on the pads, Gambhir mistimes to square leg
thats a wide, down Gambhir's leg stump, Prior collects
much better as Flintoff finds his radar, pitching on off stump, Gambhir gets forward and smothers it to the off side

pitches on a length, Gambhir gets forward and taps it to the off side, calling for the run and his old mate Sehwag responds brilliantly .. hang on a second, replays show Sehwag was hopping in the air with his bat off the ground as well when the ball disturbed the stumps, the bat got stuck and he went forward with the momentum, thats out! But there's no appeal or word from any of the umpires ....
full and wide, he square drives but cannot beat the off-side field
again he drives, this time getting an inside edge wide of leg stump
too wide outside the off stump and Gambhir leaves it be
pitches full and straightens, Gambhir works it with the swing, pushing it between mid-on and midwicket and the timing is rather excellent, lovely shot
glorious stroke, Gambhir just leans into width and square-drives imperiously through the off side, a shot of a man in great form ... did India err by opening with Tendulkar?
change of pace, pitches on a length just outside off stump, Gambhir gets across and checks his shot to midwicket
beaten! Sehwag doesn't move his feet at all, playing with an angled bat, trying to steer through gully but the ball hurries on him
well stopped at backward point after Sehwag sees width and brings the angled bat down very hard, cutting on the bounce in front of Collingwood
short into the body, Sehwag shuffles and turns it off the ribs, Patel is slow to react from square leg and concedes an easy single to Sehwag
angles across Gambhir and goes away, he leaves it be patiently
good line, gets Gambhir defending off the front foot to point
good end to a good over, pitching on a length, Gambhir defends
short of a length, Sehwag tries to pull but misses completely
wide and swinging away further, Sehwag flays but can't connect
short of a length and he cuts it well, but cant beat Collingwood
there she goes! Do not give Sehwag room, he'll punish you ... his feet don't get to the pitch of a half volley but he slams it up and over extra cover for four
wide ball again, short too, but Sehwag ends up chopping to cover
a mistimed pull, but four more, as Anderson drops in very short, allowing Sehwag swat it from outside off stump and he picks the gap just wide of mid-on

not sure what they just discussed, but if it results it rubbish like that, India will encourage them to speak six times an over! Anderson repeats another half-tracker and Sehwag swivels and hammers it flat over midwicket for six
full and wide, he drives but cannot beat Anderson at mid-off
pitches on a length and goes away, Prior collects

short ball, Gambhir gets up and drops it in front of point, calls for the manic single, Collingwood swoops in from backward point and flings the ball, Sehwag is gone for all money but Collingwood's throw cannot make contact
hits a good length and Sehwag defends it back
good shot, getting up and across and flicking a short ball away
thats the over, finally, Flintoff pitches on a length and Gambhir squirts the ball towards Collingwood at backward point
tossed up, Sehwag walks out and chips the ball over Patel's head
flatter delivery, leg stump, Gambhir shuffles and flicks it away
flat on middle and leg, Sehwag drives past midwicket, he wants two but Gambhir correctly says no thanks yaar, one will be enough
gets across and whips this one across to midwicket
again, gets across and turns this one straight to midwicket
once more, Gambhir shuffles but cannot beat midwicket
smart running from the two Delhi players, Flintoff starts off short of a length and Sehwag eases it off the bat in front of two fields and sprints off, well done
smartly edged for four wide of slips and a vacant gully, Flintoff pitches on a length and Gambhir gets a thick edge that races away to third man
short into his ribs, tucked fine and they sprint across again, raising the fifty-run partnership from 44 balls, Gambhir's contribution being 28
slashes at a wide one from his crease, and misses completely
shapes back in off a length and Sehwag chops to Collingwood at backward point
short, wide, slashes over gully, its in the air for a while and drops safely, Bopara comes sprinting around from third man to dive and cut it off well on the ropes
pitches on a length and Sehwag mistimes the drive to cover
pitches on middle and Sehwag whips it out to deep square leg
short of a length and its steered down to third man
bounced in short, Sehwag goes for the pull and sends it spiraling up in the air, its up for a while and like the last over, drops safely at fine leg, and thats his fifty, well played

superb shot! Sehwag gets half a dozen, getting up on one leg and whipping another slow bouncer down to deep square leg, the ball drops just short of the ropes and the umpires give it six ... the farce continues ... now Saheba is told via the walkie talkie and he changes his signal to four

hammered again! No need to signal four on that bulldozer of a shot! Poor Broad is not learning, still dropping short and he can only crane his neck to see the ball lands rows back over midwicket after Sehwag swats it disdainfully away
short of a length, Gambhir opens the face and dabs wide of gully
goes for a booming drive and gets beaten again
short of a length outside off, again he drives but cannot beat cover
short, angling in, Sehwag gets up and plays it softly this time, just dabbing it to the off side and calling Gambhir for the single, thats smart running

comes forward and pushes the ball to the off side, he calls, then theres confusion as Collingwood slides into view and cuts off the ball, he throws at the nonstrikers end and misses, the ball goes further away, Sehwag calls Gambhir, Pietersen gives chase ... its all happening
and what would this over be without a wide, pitched well outside off?
lands on a length and Gambhir eases the ball to cover
and he's away with a six first ball! Sehwag is not mucking around and just smacks Patel across the line and into the midwicket stands
makes room to outside leg stump and whips a fuller, flatter delivery out to Flintoff at deep midwicket for a single this time
skips down, collects on the full and hits it out past mid-on, Bell fumbles in the deep and allows the second
102ks, fired in flat on leg stump, Gambhir clips it to midwicket
quick again, into the blockhole nearly, Gambhir slogs to mid-on
flat, Sehwag clears the leg and slogs on the bounce to long-on
and gone first ball! Tossed up on the stumps, Sehwag skips down and takes it on the full, except its right up in the air and down long-on's throat, end of an entertaining innings
ah, what a shot! Gambhir uses his feet and drills this one smack past Swann, who dare not get a hand on that beast of a shot, which bisects two fielders in the deep
fired in full, he comes out and drives down the ground
makes room and slogs a full delivery along the ground to deep mid-on
shuffles around, Swann sees him and fires it down the leg side, then Gambhir goes back and shapes to tickle it fine, thats a leg bye down to square leg
fired in quick and flat, Yuvraj shuffles and cannot connect, Swann fields
short and a touch wide, he gets across and cuts to deep point
comes down, frees the arms, and hits that straight back for six
a wide, fired very far from leg stump, well taken by Prior
full and flat on leg stump, Yuvraj unwinds but inside-edges to leg
comes out, making room to go inside-out, Pietersen keeps it full and flat and it draws an inside-edge from a booming drive, beating leg stump and Prior
thats a replay from the highlights reel from the ICC World Twenty! Yuvraj just gets down on bended knee and swings Pietersen across the line, rows back for six
moves around and ends up pushing in the air towards cover
backs away and mishits a low full toss out to wide long-on

Swann gets another, and well bowled! Gambhir skips out, makes room, Swann holds back the length and turns the ball away from Gambhir, who ends up smacking it over the infield and down to Anderson near the ropes, who takes his second easy catch of the evening
massive! Swann keeps it flat and full down leg stump, but Yuvraj kneels down and sweeps him for a flat six to deep fine leg, the crowd is loving it
full on off stump, Yuvraj drives inside-out to Collingwood at point
oh good grief, he's spanked the pants off that one! Swann serves up a full toss and Dhoni pulls it miles over midwicket with immense power, thats into Cubbon Park!
skips down and drives hard across the line to midwicket for one
makes room outside leg stump, Patel smartly fires it in quick, Dhoni plays a shot only he can, some sort of whip that nearly takes out Yuvraj at the other end
well bowled, no room at all, full, flat and straight on leg stump, Yuvraj shapes to hit over midwicket but can only drive it down to mid-on for a single
super bowling, full and flat again, Dhoni backs away and drives to point
just a single, Yuvraj gets down and heaves along the ground to sweeper

timber! Patel gets a wicket with his fifth delivery, a full and flat yorker which hits the base of leg stump after Dhoni backs away and plays another of those whips to leg, thats just reward for whats been an excellent final over, a great way to keep these two batsmen quite at the death
sweet strike to end the over with a six! Yusuf Pathan! First ball, he gets underneath a slightly more tossed up delivery, backing away, and goes down town for maximum

inn2.comm: ah, beaten by a gem, pitching on short of a length and wobbling away off the seam, Bopara stands up and tries to steer it fine and misses
short of a length on off stump and Bopara plays it to cover
gets onto the front foot this time and drives straight to short cover

four dot balls, would you believe? England need nine and over and Zaheer is keeping it very tight, pitching on a length and then collecting a straight drive back from Bopara ... talk about keeping it tight, eh?
strides forward and drives hard, too much bottom hand, to mid-off
beaten off the seam, Zaheer hits a great length and moves the ball across Bell, who tries to present a front foot defence of off all shots and nearly edges
flashy drive from Bopara, backing away and looking to square drive very hard, except he's failed to make any contact whatsoever

oh well held, Ishant! The hair cut has worked wonders for the tall, lanky fast bowler! Munaf drops on a length and Bopara pulls across the line, looks to be hit okay but suddenly Ishant throws himself around full stretch to his right at mid-off, going parallel, and clutches onto a beauty to send Bopara back ... a fabulous start from India and England are 1 for 1 in the second over
pitches on a full length and Shah drives textbook straight to cover, thinks about the single but Bell sends him back as the fielder swoops in
fullish again and this time he heaves it to Sehwag at midwicket
closes his eyes and swings across the line, succeeding in inside-edging back onto his midriff, the ball parries down towards backward point, leg bye is the call from the umpire
superb line and length and Bell can only defend to backward point
there's the first boundary courtesy a proper straight drive, Shah takes toll on the full delivery and plays it back past mid-off and mid-on, beating Harbahajan's chase
back of a length, Shah drives towards point, Yuvraj runs around and dives
doesn't move his feet, swings, and misses all ends up
back of a length on middle and leg, worked straight to midwicket
overpitched and Shah clips that superbly past midwicket for four
onto the front foot, pushing the ball neatly to the man at cover
pitches on a length, Bell drives into the covers for a single
slower ball gets Shah in a mess, he was shaping to hit it over midwicket but ended up having to adjust the shot and playing it back to Munaf

so close! Munaf hits a length, Shah drives it back down the track, Munaf falls down as he tries to stop the shot, the ball flicks his fingers and ricochets into the nonstriker's stumps with a diving Bell just back inside ... that was touch and go
bouncer, 134ks and over the stumps, Shah ducks and the ball skims his shoulder blade, getting Munaf all excited but Dhoni doesn't react, rightly so
the good work continues as Munaf pitches on a length, Shah again thinks about whipping it to the leg side but the length is not on and midwicket fields
in the slot and he has a clean swing over midwicket for four
beats Bell first ball, pitching just back of a length outside off stump, a leaden-footed Bell reaches out to cut but is undone by that delivery
now he charges Ishant, who beats him again, this time with a length delivery at 140ks that swings down past leg stump, Dhoni does the collecting
the attempted slower ball slips up a full toss on top of off stump, Bell backs away and has to adjust in time, opening the face and steering the offcutter to third man
makes room and clips a full ball with the swing to deep square leg
short ball, Shah goes for the pull and inside-edges to square leg

the chaos continues for England! Bell again backs away, comes out, drives to the off side and inside edges down past leg stump, sets off, and gets sent back as Dhoni runs in, collects and fires back onto the stumps, Bell dives and just makes it
pitches on a length and Shah drives uppishly to deep mid-on
short of a length, cramps him for room, he awkwardly cuts to point
sees Bell coming down and drops it short, 140ks, the ball angles into Bell, who flays the bat at it near his face and again misses out completely
a run now, thanks to an inside edge as Bell once more makes room and drives hard, the ball skims the edge and rolls down towards square leg
a low full toss on about off stump, which Shah pats back to Zaheer
well bowled, thats a yorker into the block hole, which Shah digs out
Bell gets room and cuts just wide of backward point for one
gets down and swings, inside-edging down to fine leg
uses his feet, Yusuf sees it and keeps it flat, Bell drives to midwicket
tossed up on a length and Shah swats it powerfully from outside off stump, a sort of dragged shot, which beats a diving Yuvraj at midwicket
hello, a six now! Yusuf gives Shah length and he slogs it down the ground
good over for England! Yusuf overcompensates for the length ball and drags it short and Shah produces a lovely flat pull, swatted between two fielders
begins with a full toss, which Bell reverse-paddles for four, shot!
slower, fuller and straighter, Bell digs it out with a flick to leg
dropped by Gambhir at midwicket! The ball slips out and ends up a quick full toss, Shah makes a meal of the pull but a diving Gambhir cannot hold on
goddim! Harbhajan slows the pace, tosses it up on the stumps, Bell gets down and swings, misses, and the ball hits the sticks, simple as that
back to full and flat and thats vintage KP, clipping the ball off his pads in front of midwicket, who dives over it and cannot stop it racing to the ropes for four
top stuff, back of a length on the stumps and Shah defends
squirts a single to backward point, shuffling and playing it gently
ah, close, but its a no-ball! Ishant drops on a length, Pietersen shuffles and chips the ball in the air and it drops a few feet in front of midwicket ... free hit time
smartly pitches full and straight outside off stump, slow delivery too at 114ks, and Pietersen can only slog it to midwicket for a single
Shah drives a length ball down the ground towards long-on

bowled 'em! Thats a big wicket, Ishant draws a loose stroke from England's captain, upping the pace after the slower ball, Pietersen backs away and shapes to sort of steer that down to third man except the ball is too straight and smashes his stumps flat
short and wide and Flintoff cuts out to deep point for a single
tossed up on a length, the ball runs off the outer edge to gully

low full toss outside off stump, Shah backs away and swings, getting the toe end of the bat on it and scooping it back over Yuvraj's head, Raina dives at long-off and in one fluent move parries the ball to Gambhir, running in from the opposite end, but misses him completely and gives away four ... Yuvraj starts laughing
full and flat, Shah makes room and drives into the covers
in the slot and Flintoff biffs that straight back for a lovely boundary
tries a cheeky late cut but can only dab it to Ishant at short third man
tossed up too wide outside off, Shah holds back on the big hit
thats an expensive over, Shah using the length on offer rather well, just teeing off and clubbing that down the ground, a couple bounces and over the ropes
full and flat on leg stump, Flintoff chips it in the air over midwicket, Sehwag fields on the ropes and returns a good flat throw, Shah sends Flintoff back to his end
slower and wider, Shah waits for turn and chops it to cover
quicker ball, fuller and straighter, Shah clips to midwicket and sprints, the fielder collects and throws it in, Shah loses his bat but makes it down to his end safely
quick ball slips out and ends up full, Flintoff doesn't pick it and inside-edges down  outside off stump, near his boot
another missed opportunity by Flintoff as Harbhajan gives him another full toss, he can only mistime the big shot down towards deep mid-on
but thats cleanly hit! A glorious shot from Shah, teeing off back over the stumps, he's so dangerous when playing down the ground, and he's on 46 now
backs away and drives hard to extra cover, Harbhajan dives excellently
onto the front foot now, splicing it to Yuvraj at backward point
do not give him length! Shah gets to his fifty from 35 balls, cashing in on the room and freeing his arms with a flat-batted pull shot towards cow corner, well played
throws the bat a full one, spooning it over point, it drops in the deep and Sehwag runs around to slide and cut it off
full on the stumps, Shah defends with an inside-edge to leg
with third man just up, Flintoff smartly opens the face and dabs a wide ball past Zaheer and gets four to end the over
excellent shot, Shah! With a clean swing, Shah fetches that from outside off stump and dumps it into the deep midwicket stands, Yuvraj is getting tonked here
full and flat on leg stump, flicked with an edge to Zaheer at short fine leg
exposes the stumps and uses the pace, opening the face and dabbing it through gully, the ball dribbles towards the ropes and the sweeper cuts it off
flatter on the stumps, Flintoff backs away and gets cramped for room, all he can do is push a single into the covers but it gets the dangerous Shah back on strike
shuffles and drives down the ground to Harbhajan at long-on
makes room and cuts a single out to deep cover sweeper
thats a quick full toss, which Flintoff finally get a hold of, pulling over midwicket, Yusuf runs around on the ropes and sticks a hand out in vain
going, going, gone! Thats massive! In fact, its onto the roof! Flintoff takes Harbhajan with the turn, heaving him miles into the starry night for six

change of pace, full and flat, Flintoff steers a single into the off side, Gambhir fires in a hard throw onto the nonstriker's stumps, Harbhajan gets out of the way and that allows the second, sloppy from India
tossed up on the stumps, and another driven single to the off side
fired in, Shah clips it fine, Tendulkar dives at short fine and saves runs
another full toss, which Flintoff drives down the ground for one
makes room, skips down, drives into the covers for a single
wow, six more ! Shah walks across and takes that one ever so sweetly, using that bottom hand to excellent effect, taking the length ball and hitting over midwicket
a full toss surprises Shah, who pushes it down to mid-on for one
shuffles across and drives very hard down to Gambhir at long-off
makes room and drills a half volley out to deep cover sweeper
a touch full again, Flintoff keeps strike with a drive to long-off
well bowled, keeping it full from over the stumps, a leg-stump line, Flintoff makes room and cannot nudge the ball into the gaps, a dot ball to add the pressure
walks outside leg stump and swings, the ball sneaks though and clips his thigh, beats Dhoni and Tendulkar runs after it down to the ropes
swings hard and mistimes the slog to mid-on for a single
tight stuff, flat on a length and Shah plays it back to Yuvraj
just a single, Shah shuffles and nudges the ball to square leg

makes room and cuts to extra cover, then sets off, Zaheer collects and returns the ball to Yuvraj, who is fractionally slow to disturb the sticks as a burly Flintoff comes hurtling into frame with a dive
good ball, the attempted yorker, Flintoff can only push it to mid-off
gets room and drives out to deep cover, Yusuf fields and fires it back
wide full toss, asking for trouble, Flintoff slaps it to Tendulkar at point
excellent bowling, a yorker on off stump, jammed down the ground
and Zaheer gets Shah, standing and twirling the bat at this one on a length, he absolutely makes a mess of it and Tendulkar takes a simple catch at point
opens the face and steers it to a sliding Yuvraj at point
very full and straight, Flintoff drills it very hard back to Ishant, who does well to take some pace off the shot, Flintoff scampers a single as mid-off runs in
thats four, Collingwood shuffles and paddles it over square leg, the ball lands and spins away from Harbhajan on the ropes, who overruns it
gets a half volley and drives to extra cover, where Zaheer releases a sharp throw but Collingwood is such a hare between the wickets
slower ball does the trick! Flintoff backs away and spoons the ball straight to Zaheer's lap at extra cover and India have taken control of the batting Powerplay emphatically
top shot, a glorious on-drive across the stumps through midwicket
beats him with a slower ball, which starts out a low dipping full toss but somehow sneaks past the bat and Dhoni collects
fired in flat and full, Collingwood shuffles and drives to midwicket
flatter trajectory, Patel dabs the ball to point for a single
unfurls a reverse sweep, Gambhir flings himself around at short third man and saves a couple for his side
expectedly, full and flat, Collingwood clips one to raise 150
low full toss, Patel makes room and slaps it out to deep cover
and Collingwood gets it! Harbhajan fires it down leg stump and Collingwood escorts it down to deep square leg with an effective little clip, crucial runs
attempts a yorker, Patel squeezes it out into the covers for one
shuffles across and swings, eyes closed, cops it on the thigh and Patel calls Collingwood through for the leg bye
bouncer, Patel takes his eyes off the ball too but connects on his two-stepped pull shot, picks the gap over square leg and pummels back for the second run
full on leg stump and Patel flicks it through midwicket for two more
makes room and swings, connecting with nuttin' but air

Gambhir holds onto one! Patel gets back and slaps a low full toss to mid-off, where Gambhir crouches down and takes it, then sees it pop back out, so dives forward and takes it on the second attempt ... his team-mates rush towards him to slap him on the back for holding on
hammers a full toss down to Raina at long-on, so just a single
pitches outside off, Swann makes room and cannot connect
slower ball, on a length, Swann backs away and dabs it to point
change of pace again, the cutter pitches and dribbles away from Collingwood's wild swing, but its then called a wide ... wont make a difference anyway
takes a full ball from outside off and heaves to midwicket, Harbhajan collects and needlessly throws the ball at the nonstriker's end, allowing the second run, and Dhoni gives him a piece of his mind
swings a full toss out to Sehwag, one bounce at deep midwicket
full and he just manages to jam it wide of backward point for four
a really wide delivery, served up outside the stumps
another loose ball, a big full toss down leg stump, Collingwood shuffles and heaves it through short fine leg and picks the gap ... Munaf is mortified!
heaves it to midwicket and bolts off, Tendulkar throws it back to Munaf, who is slow to break the bails and Collingwood is home safe with a big dive
moves away, skips down, swings and misses, Dhoni fumbles

easy as pie, Collingwood pushes a very full ball back to Munaf, Swann takes off and makes for the other end, Collingwood doesn't even react, Munaf collects and effects the easiest run out of his career with both batsmen saying hello to each other at one end
ho hum, Collingwood swings straight to Tendulkar at midwicket
swing and a miss, and thats the end of that, India win by 19 runs!
